note_text:
Admission Date:  [**2196-3-30**]              Discharge Date:   [**2196-4-1**]

Date of Birth:  [**2111-4-29**]             Sex:   F

Service: NEUROSURGERY

Allergies:
No Known Allergies / Adverse Drug Reactions

Attending:[**First Name3 (LF) 1835**]
Chief Complaint:
Headache

Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
Left Temporal craniotomy for excision of tumor


History of Present Illness:
84yo F who developed headaches and noted a leftsided scalp
lesion 3 weeks prior to presentation in clinic.  A brain MRI
with and without gadolinium was done on
[**2196-3-11**] done at [**Hospital6 19155**] revealed a 3.3 by 3.4
by 3.4cm mass in the left skull at the junction of the squamous
portion of the temporal bone and the parietal bone.
No numbness, weakness, tingling, blurred vision, double vision.

Past Medical History:
Hyptertension
Hypothyroidism
hx of ECT 8 years ago for Depression

Social History:
She lives alone and is able to do all of her ADLs. She drives.
She smoked [**4-8**] cigarettes daily for 40 years and quit 20 years
ago. She drinks one alcoholic beverage per week. She has no
other
history of drug use. She has a supportive family.


Family History:
Mother had skin cancer.
No other cancers in the family.


Physical Exam:
Gen: WD/WN, comfortable, NAD.
HEENT: Pupils: 5 to 3 b        EOMs intact
Neck: Supple.
Extrem: Warm and well-perfused.
Neuro:
Mental status: Awake and alert, cooperative with exam, normal
affect.
Orientation: Oriented to person, place, and date.
Recall: [**4-7**] objects at 5 minutes.
Language: Speech fluent with good comprehension and repetition.
Naming intact. No dysarthria or paraphasic errors.

Cranial Nerves:
I: Not tested
II: Pupils equally round and reactive to light, to
mm bilaterally. Visual fields are full to confrontation.
III, IV, VI: Extraocular movements intact bilaterally without
nystagmus.
V, VII: Facial strength and sensation intact and symmetric.
VIII: Hearing intact to voice.
IX, X: Palatal elevation symmetrical.
[**Doctor First Name 81**]: Sternocleidomastoid and trapezius normal bilaterally.
XII: Tongue midline without fasciculations.

Motor: Normal bulk and tone bilaterally. No abnormal movements,
tremors. Strength full power [**6-9**] throughout
No pronator drift

Sensation: Intact to light touch
Coordination: normal on finger-nose-finger

Exam on discharge: No Change.

Pertinent Results:
MRI Brain [**2196-3-30**]: 4.5 x 4.5 x 3.6 cm mass involving the
parietal bone, parietal temporal bone and extending both intra-
and extracranially as described above, likely due to
plasmocytoma of metastasis. The examination was performed with
markers for surgical planning.

CT head [**2196-3-30**]: postoperative changes

CT Chest/Abd/Pelvic [**2196-3-29**]:
1. Complex 6.5 cm cyst within the lower pole of the right kidney
with large mural nodules concerning for primary renal neoplasm.
2. Exophytic enhancing lesion of the upper pole of the right
kidney which
may reflect additional neoplastic focus.

Labs:
[**2196-4-1**] 05:50AM BLOOD WBC-15.5* RBC-4.01* Hgb-12.1 Hct-34.9*
MCV-87 MCH-30.1 MCHC-34.6 RDW-13.6 Plt Ct-132*
[**2196-4-1**] 05:50AM BLOOD Glucose-98 UreaN-16 Creat-0.7 Na-134
K-3.5 Cl-103 HCO3-24 AnGap-11
[**2196-4-1**] 05:50AM BLOOD Albumin-2.9* Calcium-8.2* Phos-1.6*
Mg-1.7
[**2196-4-1**] 05:50AM BLOOD Phenyto-7.4*

Brief Hospital Course:
Pt was admitted for Left Temporal craniotomy for excision of
left temporal skull and brain lesion on [**2196-3-30**] under general
anesthesia.  Pt tolerated the procedure well, was extubated and
transfered to the ICU for Q1 hour neurochecks, systolic blood
pressure control and general ICU care.  She received a Dilantin
load and was started on Dilantin 100mg TID.  Postoperatively she
did well and remained neurologically intact.  She was transfered
to the stepdown unit on POD1 and then to the regular floor.

Hematology/Oncology was consulted for her new right kidney mass
and she will followup as an outpatient with Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 3748**] from
Urology.  Neuro-oncology and Radiation Oncology were consulted
for treatment of her skull and brain tumor.

She was seen and evaluated by physical therapy and occupational
therapy who felt that she was stable to go home with PT/OT
services.

Dilantin levels were followed and on [**4-1**] her Dilantin level was
7.4 which corrects to 10.9 in the setting of a low albumin level
of 2.9 and is in therapeutic range.

At the time of discharge on POD2 she is tolerating a regular
diet, ambulating with an assistive device, afebrile with stable
vital signs.

Medications on Admission:
Levothyroxine 75mcg Daily

Discharge Medications:
1. senna 8.6 mg Tablet Sig: 1-2 Tablets PO HS (at bedtime).
2. acetaminophen 325 mg Tablet Sig: Two (2) Tablet PO TID (3
times a day) as needed for prn pain.
3. tramadol 50 mg Tablet Sig: 0.5 Tablet PO Q6H (every 6 hours)
as needed for pain.
Disp:*60 Tablet(s)* Refills:*0*
4. docusate sodium 100 mg Capsule Sig: One (1) Capsule PO BID (2
times a day).
5. multivitamin     Tablet Sig: 1-2 Tablets PO DAILY (Daily).
6. levothyroxine 75 mcg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO DAILY
(Daily).
7. phenytoin 50 mg Tablet, Chewable Sig: Two (2) Tablet,
Chewable PO every eight (8) hours.
Disp:*180 Tablet, Chewable(s)* Refills:*2*


Discharge Disposition:
Home With Service

Facility:
[**Company 1519**]

Discharge Diagnosis:
Left temporal skull and brain tumor
Right Kidney mass


Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.


Discharge Instructions:
General Instructions/Information

??????	Have a friend/family member check your incision daily for
signs of infection.
??????	Take your pain medicine as prescribed.
??????	Exercise should be limited to walking; no lifting, straining,
or excessive bending.
??????	You may wash your hair only after sutures and/or staples have
been removed. If your wound closure uses dissolvable sutures,
you must keep that area dry for 10 days.
??????	You may shower before this time using a shower cap to cover
your head.
??????	Increase your intake of fluids and fiber, as narcotic pain
medicine can cause constipation. We generally recommend taking
an over the counter stool softener, such as Docusate (Colace)
while taking narcotic pain medication.
??????	Unless directed by your doctor, do not take any
anti-inflammatory medicines such as Motrin, Aspirin, Advil, and
Ibuprofen etc.
??????	You have been prescribed Dilantin (Phenytoin) for anti-seizure
medicine, take it as prescribed and follow up with laboratory
blood drawing in one week.  This can be drawn at your PCP??????s
office, but please have the results faxed to [**Telephone/Fax (1) 87**].
??????	Clearance to drive and return to work will be addressed at
your post-operative office visit.
??????	Make sure to continue to use your incentive spirometer while
at home.
CALL YOUR SURGEON IMMEDIATELY IF YOU EXPERIENCE ANY OF THE
FOLLOWING

??????	New onset of tremors or seizures.
??????	Any confusion or change in mental status.
??????	Any numbness, tingling, weakness in your extremities.
??????	Pain or headache that is continually increasing, or not
relieved by pain medication.
??????	Any signs of infection at the wound site: increasing redness,
increased swelling, increased tenderness, or drainage.
??????	Fever greater than or equal to 101?????? F.


Followup Instructions:
??????You have an appointment in the Brain [**Hospital 341**] Clinic, wound check
at that time. We will call you with the appointment date and
time.  The Brain [**Hospital 341**] Clinic is located on the [**Hospital Ward Name 516**] of
[**Hospital1 18**], in the [**Hospital Ward Name 23**] Building, [**Location (un) **]. Their phone number is
[**Telephone/Fax (1) 1844**]. Please call if you need to change your
appointment, or require additional directions.
??????You will need an MRI of the brain with/ without gadolinium
contrast.  If you are required to have a MRI, you may also
require a blood test to measure your BUN and Cr within 30 days
of your MRI.  This can be measured by your PCP, [**Name10 (NameIs) **] please
make sure to have these results with you, when you come in for
your appointment.

-[**2196-4-21**]  01:15p   [**Last Name (LF) **],[**First Name3 (LF) **] A.
  [**Hospital6 29**], [**Location (un) **]
  UROLOGY CC3 (NHB)
Followup as above with Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 3748**] of Urology for your new
diagnosis or right renal mass.  Call ([**Telephone/Fax (1) 8791**] with
questions.

- You will also need followup with the Oncologists for your new
diagnosis.  The Oncology team will call you with the appointment
date and time.

- You will need to schedule a nuclear medicine bone scan prior
to your Oncology appointment, please have them schedule the test
when they call you with the appointment date and time.
